premise_source_doc_sentence: Stanley Kubrick  (  -LSB- ˈkuːbrɪk -RSB- July 26 , 1928 -- March 7 , 1999  )  was an American film director , screenwriter , producer , cinematographer , editor , and photographer .

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Kubrick was born and raised in the Bronx , New York City , and attended William Howard Taft High School from 1941 to 1945 .

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Although he only received average grades , Kubrick displayed a keen interest in literature , photography , and film from a young age , and taught himself all aspects of film production and directing after graduating from high school .

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.
premise_source_doc_sentence: After working as a photographer for Look magazine in the late 1940s and early 1950s , he began making short films on a shoestring budget , and made his first major Hollywood film , The Killing , for United Artists in 1956 .

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Creative differences arising from his work with Douglas and the film studios , a dislike of Hollywood , and a growing concern about crime in America prompted Kubrick to move to the United Kingdom in 1961 , where he spent most of the remainder of his life and career .

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.

claim: Stanley Kubrick directed No Country for Old Men.
